intro: Rhinanthus alectorolophus subvar. patulus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yellow rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has lance-shaped leaves and a hairy stem, which help it thrive in sunny conditions. This subvariety is often found in the British Isles and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and floral characteristics.
